page.title: 02Domesday entry,Sandridge
page.content: The village was called Sandridge, because it was built on a ridge of sand. Sandridge was very small in 1086, the year that the Domesday Book was compiled.Sandridge was entered in the book as:26 peasants or villagers, 10 ploughs,2 cottagers,1 slave, Woodland for 300 pigs.Its total value was Â£18.00. Compare that to what it is like now: population of just over 2000.It has a garage,post office,3 public houses, a local store,2 churches,village hall, cub hut,mobile library and a school. You can see how much Sandridge has changed in 900 years.
